unnormalised: ## Going Viral, Desi Style: What's Trending on Social Media?
normalised: ## Going Viral, Desi Style: What's Trending on Social Media?

unnormalised: Hey fam! So, you want to break the internet, right? Become the next Bhuvan Bam or Prajakta Koli? Well, understanding virality trends is key. And trust me, it's more than just luck. Let’s dive into what’s making waves these days.
normalised: Hey fam! So, you want to break the internet, right? Become the next Bhuvan Bam or Prajakta Koli? Well, understanding virality trends is key. And trust me, it's more than just luck. Let’s dive into what’s making waves these days.

unnormalised: First off, short-form video content is still KING. Think Reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts. The attention span of the average Sharmaji's son scrolling through Instagram is like, what, 8 seconds? So, keep it snappy, keep it engaging. Comedy ALWAYS works, especially stuff that’s relatable to the average Indian. Remember that "Rasode Mein Kaun Tha" remix? Pure gold!

unnormalised: Secondly, authentic storytelling is HUGE. People are tired of seeing perfectly curated lives. They want to see real struggles, real wins. Share your journey, whether it’s prepping for your UPSC exam or starting a small business in your mohalla. Honesty resonates. Think about the success of Humans of Bombay – it's all about telling real stories.

unnormalised: Another thing I’ve noticed is the rise of regional content. From Tamil Nadu to Punjab, people are vibing with content in their local languages. So, if you're fluent in a regional language, tap into that market! There’s a massive untapped audience there. Plus, incorporating cultural elements – like celebrating Diwali on 24/10/2023 or featuring iconic landmarks like the Gateway of India – can give your content that extra "desi" flavour.

unnormalised: Challenges and trends also come and go like auto rickshaws in Mumbai traffic. Keep an eye out for the latest dance craze or audio clip that's blowing up. Joining these can give you a quick boost in visibility. Remember the "Bachpan Ka Pyaar" trend?

unnormalised: Finally, don’t underestimate the power of collaboration. Partnering with other creators can expose your content to a whole new audience. Think about collaborating with someone who makes amazing Ladoo recipes if you're into fitness – a healthy ladoo challenge could be just the ticket!
